p: Previous studies by Matthews et al. ( 1995, 1997) identified shortening growing periods (same as this study) and increasing spikelet sterility (contrary to this study) as the two main causes of future yield decline in Asia. This has spurred much research on heat induced sterility and so called “critical temperatures”. However, some recent studies still look at maximum air temperatures (Gourdji, Sibley, & Lobell, 2013), not accounting for transpirational cooling and early flowering. And no study so far has identified reduced assimilation at extreme temperatures as a possible cause of future rice yield reductions. Identifying these underlying mechanisms is relevant for breeders when screening for heat tolerant breeding material and can help formulate more specific follow‐up research questions.
